intro: Petasites frigidus subsp. articus, commonly known as the Arctic buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cold, moist environments and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and colonize new areas effectively. The species is adapted to low temperatures and has mechanisms to survive harsh winter conditions.
